Class Part

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--Primitive
        |
        +--Sphere
              |
              +--Part
All Implemented Interfaces:
Inertial, Location
public class Part
extends Sphere
implements Inertial

This is the class for all objects that interact with the gravitational field in the simulation. They are graphically represented a spheres with a radius proportial to the cube root of the mass. They further feature graphic displaying of acceleration and velocity. This is shown as two lines in the respective directions with lengths directly proportional to the relevant kinematical quantity.

Constructor Detail

Part

public Part(Vector3 pos,
            double mass)
Creates a new particle. Newly created particles have no initial velocity, and are not affected by the gravitational field, although they themselves contribute.
Parameters:
pos - The initial position of the particle
mass - The mass of the particle
Method Detail

activate

public void activate()
Tells the particle to adjust it's acceleration to the current gravitational field. In effect this function tells the particle to start taking an active part in the simulation.
Specified by:
activate in interface Inertial

frame

public void frame()
Description copied from class: Sphere
Tells the sphere to draw itself.
Overrides:
frame in class Sphere

move

public void move(int dt)
This function tells the object to move through a distance matched by the time dt. In the particles case, this means adjusting the velocity by the acceleration, and them moving.
Specified by:
move in interface Inertial
Parameters:
dt - The time to move through.

fall

public void fall(Graviton[] grav)
          throws CollisionEvent
This function tells the particle to adjust it's acceleration in accordance to the current gravitational field. Only the acceleration is actually changed by calling the function. In order to actually move the object, move must be called. However, if too objects are too close, they are merged together by the throwing of a collision exception.
Parameters:
grav - An array of gravitons that define the current gravitational field.
Throws:
CollisisonEvent - If two objects are too close, they will be merged together into one larger particle. No more calculations will be performed on the current object in that frame.

getGrav

public Graviton getGrav()
Generates a Graviton object. Used to inform the scene how this particle affects the current gravitational field.
Returns:
The graviton describing the current object.

setFocus

public void setFocus(boolean b)
Tells this object weather it has focus or not. Focus means that the mouse points to the current object. The particle's normal response should be to repaint itself in some other style or colour.
Parameters:
b - Weather this object has focus or not.

Sets the Gravitational constant for all particles scene.

Toggles weather to show kinematical information graphically or not.

Sets the kinematics state. Used to make sure the proper state is set when program starts.
